author: {'steamid': '76561198137376448', 'num_games_owned': 6881, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 215, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1711686029}
review:
[b]One of those cases when I'd give a neutral review if I had the option, but unfortunately it falls shorts in way too many aspects for the experience to be more on the "recommended" side.[/b]

Pros:
- There's something really unique, mysterious and intriguing about the story in this game that makes you wanna keep going and figure out what is going on.
- Very mesmerizing bizarre, surreal, and oneiric atmosphere.

Neutrals:
- Puzzles vary a little bit. Some are ok, some are too easy, others are a bit too unintuitive (ie 'moon logic'). Sometimes they feel rewarding, sometimes they feel boring, and sometimes they make you go 'ugh...'.

Cons:
- The game is way too short. My playtime (3.6 h) includes 2 playthroughs (I played the 2nd time to help me understand a few parts after going through it all, and also to hunt the the achievements I had missed while playing freely). I'll return to this point during the other cons, because it has a few implications.
- The main characters walks WAY TOO SLOWLY, even for a walking simulator standard. It's so sluggish that [u]it feels like you're a geisha doing the oiran walk underwater while carrying a 200-pound boulder[/u]. This feels like it was a deliberate choice in order to make this short game seem longer than it actually is more than anything else. And note that you don't have too much stuff to contemplate like in most walking simulators, so it's not a relaxing experience.
- Looking around, interacting with stuff and dialogues also feel VERY slow. Also you have to wait for the dialogue to completely end (plus what it feels like 5 idle seconds) before you can interact with objects again. This too feels like it was deliberate in order to make the game feel longer than it actually is. But the main problem is that the controlling experience is just awful.
- The narrative approach is so surreal that it ends up being too nonsensical and you don't get too many straight answers. On my second playthrough, a few things made more sense, but at the same time a lot of them just felt like they were randomly put in order to trigger the player's curiosity, but it kinda feels like cheating into reaching that goal.
- The game is so short that you have little time to connect and relate to the characters, which are obviously underdeveloped for the length of the game. The story has a lot of potential to be impactful and evoke emotions, but that job becomes nearly impossible if you have no time to fall in love with the characters.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
While this is not a total miss and could provide fun in some level, I'd say there are better titles out there that do a lot better in areas where his game fails to shine. To name a few from the top of my head: What Remais of Edith Finch, Papo y Yo, Rakuen, Call of the Sea, The Vanishing of Ethan Carter...

review:
Es ist kein Edith Finch oder Firewatch, aber ein durchgehend solides trauriges Adventure welches teilweise durch unnötige Gameplay-elemente gezogen wird - das emotionale Pacing könnte enorm stark sein, wenn es sich einfach auf das Storytelling fokussiert hätte, die kleinen "Puzzles" die das Spiel hat wirken eher negativ auf die Gesamterfahrung. 

Vollkommen in Ordnung, das Writing der beiden Hauptcharaktere ist definitiv die Stärke des Games und es schafft es beeindruckend stark den Bruder EXAKT zwischen super nervig und menschlich nachvollziehbar einzureihen

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198095685215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1690389309}
review:
J’aimerais avoir apprécié ce jeu mais je ne le recommanderais pas ; en tout cas pas hors soldes pour ceux qui si intéresser.
Oui les graphique son bien blablabla, mais on ne le dira jamais assez le plus important reste la jouabilité et l’histoire.
Je m’explique :
-La maniabilité du personnage est comme celle d’un camion. Elle n’est pas impossible, il faut un temps d’adaptation 
-Je rebondis sur le deuxième point décevant  est que le jeu prend entre 1h30 et 2h (et c’est encore large comme estimation). Et avec cette maniabilité deviens frustrant durant la moitie de ceux temps.
- Même si l’histoire est intéressante, elle n’est pas originale. Les thèmes abordés ont déjà  été vue ailleurs, parfois même mieux. Je n’ai pas pue m’empercher de comparer ce jeu à Draugen tout du long.
Les deux jeux abordent les mêmes thèmes dans leur histoire, mais pour moi Draugen  à mieux su faire fonctionner l’intégration de l’histoire dans son univers que Blackwood Crossing. 

J’ai dû m’endormir à un moment clés de l’histoire parce que j’ai trouvé l’histoire confuse j’avais plus de question à la fin qu'au début, des choses toutes bêtes qui auraient pu être résolue avec une phrase de dialogue.

Je suis contente d’avoir fini ce jeu et de me dire que je n’y jouerais plus jamais.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984034656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1686593093}
review:
I run the walking simulator fan group (check my profile for more titles) so i think my review is based on a solid 60+ other similar title reviews. 

Bottom line, Is it the best walking sim out there? No.  Is it a mixed bag ? Yes.  While not as innovative as "Before your Eyes" , it completes it nicely if you prefer the traditional 'Walking sims' with a TINY hint of puzzling.

Two major issues:
1 - the story however is telegraphed from the very beginning, so I don't see how there could be spoilers , and that's going to hurt the rating a bit , for sure.
2- the mechanics are clunky at best
3 - there' a lot of walking back and forth

Production values are good and i had a steady 60fps for most of the game on a 2080 at 1080p, however the begginning of the game can be a bit choppy. Audio/voice over is great but make sure you lower 'music and bg sound' before raising the overall volume as things can get a bit lost in the noise.

Overall this is a 5/10 considering what is the market at a similar price. But on a sale, it's a no brainer for the fans of the genre.

review:
Puanım 6/10
Oyunun hikayesini fena bulmasam da oynanış açısından oldukça kötü buldum.
Özellikle oyunun başında oyuncuya bazı eşyaları toplayabilmesine izin vermesi ve daha sonrasında farklı cevaplar verebilme imkanının olması oyuncuya "Agency" sahibi olduğu izlenimini veriyor fakat durum bu değil. Oyunda yaptığınız şeyler bir bulmacanın parçalarını çözmekten öteye gidemiyor (sadece bazı şeyleri yapmazsanız başarım alamıyorsunuz). Dolayısı ile oyunun sonucu hiçbir şekilde değişmiyor, hayal kırıklığına uğradığımı söylemek isterim. Güncel fiyatı 25 lira olduğu için şu cümleyi kurabilirim: "25 liraya interaktif film izlemek istiyorsanız bu oyunu alabilirsiniz."

author: {'steamid': '76561198094903967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1639919341}
review:
Blackwood Crossing erzählt von Trauer, Verlust, von Liebe und Vertrauen. Die perfekte Mischung für Herzschmerz. Spielerisch kann man das Spiel wohl als Walking Simulator beschreiben, der garniert ist durch einige simple Rätsel. Es fällt auf, dass der Fokus ganz klar auf dem Erzählen der Geschichte der beiden Geschwister und ihrer Familie liegt - und das gelingt!

Wer sich also auf eine emotionale Geschichte einlassen will, die einem auch die ein oder andere Träne entlocken wird, der wird bei Blackwood Crossing fündig. Einziges Manko: Mit einer Spielzeit von knapp drei Stunden ist das Vergnügen relativ kurz, was dem Storytelling aber keinen Abbruch tut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088102831', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1624313894}
review: This is a very poignant game that touches on familial loss and what it can take to work through grief. Mingles melancholy topics with some very fantastical Alice in Wonderland vibes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025111305', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1627171099}
review:
Peng Peng oder big Bumm? FOV wie ein Fischauge? Dann bitte Finger weg. Das ist nix für Dich.

Wessen Empathiefähigkeit aber tiefer als der eines Wassertropfen ist wird hier mit einem kurzweiligen. dennoch sehr angenehmen Erlebnis belohnt an dessem Ende man trotzdem je nach besagter Empathie gerne mal ein paar dicke Tränen verliert.
Ja die Steuerung ist mehhh aber außer vorwärts und rückwärts braucht's nicht wirklich mehr. Die Geschichte wird quasi wie in einem Walking Sim erzählt und offenbart im Laufe immer wieder Überraschungen so das man eigentlich nie das Gefühl hat an der Hand genommen zu sein. 
Und das Titellied 'The Crossing' von Ben Otetwell ist mal so gut das ich mir das auch noch gekauft habe, Gibt es aber leider nicht hier, einfach nach suchen... gibt nicht viele Quellen.
Also, du hast nicht die Empathie eines Schlagschraubers, kannst auch mal Tränen verkraften und magst Geschichten die dich berühren? Dann greif zu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248415390', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1634593446}
review:
A game about the loss of loved ones. You solve various puzzles in order to catch up with your brother or just make him happy. 
Outstanding facial animations and the voice-acting makes you feel the emotional bond between the family members. The soundtrack creates a both joyful and melancholic experience. The visual design is beautiful. I completed the game twice, one time to enjoy the game and another one to complete the remaining achievements. Took about 3 hours in total.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010816447', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1630941153}
review: Was für ein Müllgame. Die Steuerung ist dermaßen schwammig und unpräzise, dass einem im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes das Kotzen kommt. Zusätzlich bekommt man von dem Mega-Kopfgewackel der dämlichen Protagonistin und dem niedrigen FOV in kürzester Zeit massive Kopfschmerzen. Die Story ist total bescheuert und kitschig, und die meiste Zeit hat man nicht die leiseste Ahnung, was man eigentlich machen soll, da überhaupt nichts erklärt wird. Die Protagonistin bewegt sich zudem dermaßen lahmarschig und im Schneckentempo, dass sich das Ganze zu einer Geduldsprobe übelster Art ausweitet, da man Story-bedingt ständig hin- und herlaufen muss. Darüber hinaus geht einem dieser hyperaktive, dämliche Bengel gehörig auf den Sack. Obendrauf gibt es noch die beschissene Unity-Engine mit ständigem Geruckel gratis. Fazit: Dreck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977657096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1629917328}
review:
Angenehme Mischung aus etwas gruselig und gut erzählten Charakteren. Oft genug rätselhaft, aber auch nicht zu abgedreht, mit der Zeit habe ich die Figuren und ihre Rollen eigentlich verstanden. Die Atmosphäre liegt zwischen dem manchmal noch düsteren The Vanishing of Ethan Carter und Everybody has gone to the rapture, nur mit mehr Gequassel von dem Jungen (nervt aber nicht).

Die Grafik ist okay, für den Anspruch des Spiels, die Sprecher und Sprecherinnen auf jeden Fall auf hohem Niveau und die Länge mit zwei Stunden völlig ausreichend, mehr hätte die Geschichte nicht hergegeben. Manchmal nervt die langsame Bewegung der Hauptfigur etwas, hier und da fühlt die sich etwas hölzern an, es geht aber.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040168362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1625001545}
review:
I don`t like to give ambitious indie developers negative reviews, so I'm not going to.
But truth be told, this game was a bit of a mixed bag for me. 
While visually beautiful and with a great soundtrack and good voice acting, the game was hampered by some questionable game design choices. 
Like the absurdly slow walking speed, which I`m usually alright with in walking sims, but the amount of backtracking in this game really made me wish there was a sprint-button.
Or items that you can only pick up once you`ve triggered the required "Pick up that item to solve the next puzzle"-dialogue-option, although it`s perfectly clear it`s the item you need to solve the next puzzle.
Or when the game wants you to find and collect that one specific item to solve a riddle, although there are loads of other viable alternatives lying around everywhere. (Minor puzzle spoiler, if you`re curious: [spoiler] I'm talking about a puzzle that requires you to find a specific newspaper roll to use as a torch, in a relatively large area littered with stuff just as flammable. And to top things off, the game wants you to light your torch on a pile of trash that`s already on fire - and could have served as torch just as well.[/spoiler])

There`s an intersting and melodramatic story at the heart of this game (which I´m not going to spoil, for obvious reasons).
But the fragmented presentation and the many fantastical styilistic elements, made it difficult for me to connect with the characters emotionally.

If you`re into walking simulators, that walk a bit on the experimental side of storytelling (pun very much intended) and you`re looking for a mellow game with a bit of a darker twist, this might be your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045849846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1624147000}
review:
A masterpiece! Awesome soundtrack, well-written story and a good ending to that story. A must buy for everyone who likes short story games. 10/10 from me for short.

Blackwood Crossing is a story-rich puzzle game. It has awesome soundtracks, at least I liked them. The story and the way this game tells it is heart-wrenching yet simple. There are no hidden signals to what might have been. The story is told slowly but simply. Warning though, you might need some napkins as you reach the 100 minute mark, as the ending of the game is the most emotional part of the game. I think it's totally worth it's price even without any discount. I'm not an emotion-driven person, or one that really values most of it, but this game brought tears even to my eyes. Well done developers, well done! Might be the shortest game that I see a 10/10 worth giving to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074315865', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1622932494}
review: Blackwood Crossing is a first-person adventure game, heavily story-driven but really, really short. In about 2 hours you'll finish this game which has some very bad controls. The interaction mechanic is cluncky implemented and raises your frustration levels. The story however, is very emotional and really gets you in the end. All in all a fine in-between game if you can pick it up with a (huge) discount like me, 16 bucks isn't just right for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125235157', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1618996538}
review:
Among the walking sim genre (we gotta get a better name for that), its visually distinct from the pack. I think its art style adds a nice layer to its storybook premise. Its a little too blunt though, saying things that I think should be whispered instead of shouted. It feels a little inspired by Rule of Rose, but it lacks the ambiguity that really worked for that game.

At the same time, maybe I shouldn't have played it at 1 to 3 am right after finishing Kentucky Route Zero, a game I'm still riding the high of. That could be on me and its not the game's fault I'm stuck in that zone. Also its only choice (stopping the fire vs making it burn brighter) carries that same sort of "well, what choice means more to you?" KR0 spirit I like. Is it better to hold onto those precious memories or just let them go? Its a really interesting choice to give players and its really the only sense you get that the devs wanted their audience to freely interpret the game as they wish.

All in all though, I think Scarlett made a good pick in dating Cam. That dude seems just like a straight up chill, reliable boyfriend. Better give that guy a ring now that you're out of that purgatory, girl. Game is fun, worth the two hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198165686988', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1620978678}
review:
플레이타임: 약 2시간
난이도: 영어가 되면 어렵지 않음. 크게 어려운 영어는 아니지만 자신없으면 하지 말자.
볼륨: 딱 2시간 분량 나올만큼. 도전과제 100% 노리는게 아니고서야 다회차 할 필요 없음
특이사항: 스토리상 반전과 감동적인 결말, 그리고 끝날때 나오는 노래가 되게 좋다.
[hr][/hr]
주인공 스칼렛과 남동생 핀이 기차를 타고 가다가 토끼 가면을 쓴 소년을 만나 신비한 경험을 하는 이야기이다.
그냥 보면 스토리가 잘 이해가 안되는데, 결말에서 진실이 드러난다. 스토리 스포일러는 아래에
[spoiler] 게임에서 스칼렛과 핀은 계속 같이 다니긴 했지만, 사실 핀은 예전에 죽었다. 가면을 쓰고 나오는 스칼렛의 가족과 주변인물도 아마 죽은 것으로 추정된다. 이 게임은 스칼렛이 혼자 기차를 타고가다 꾼 꿈(혹은 꿈 속에서 사후세계에 간) 이야기인데, 핀과 함께했던 추억을 되짚으며 그를 놓아 주기까지의 과정이다. 스칼렛은 그동안 모르고 있었지만 핀이 겪었던 일들도 알게 되고, 핀과 싸웠던 기억에 미안해하기도 하는데, 토끼 소년과 부모님의 도움으로 핀을 보내줄 수 있었다. 누나로서 핀을 돌봐주었어야 했는데 그가 괴롭힘당하는 것도 모르고 있었고, 자기는 캠이랑 연애하느라 놀아주지도 못했다는 죄책감에서 해방된 것이다. 결국 이 게임은 스칼렛이 핀에게 용서받고 정신적으로 성숙해지는 과정이다.[/spoiler]

게임은 그냥 퍼즐 게임이다. 상호작용이 가능한 대상에 가서 적절한 도구를 들고 적절한 버튼을 누르면 된다. 이 게임만의 특이한 시스템이라면 가면을 쓴 사람들의 대화를 연결하는 것이 있다. 특정 지점에서 가면을 쓴 사람 여럿(주로 8명)이 등장해 가만히 있는데, 이들을 클릭하면 한 마디씩 말을 하고, 그 말을 토대로 서로 대화하는 두 사람을 찾아 순서대로 상호작용하면 된다. 이렇게 모두를 둘씩 짝지으면 다음으로 진행할 수 있다. 이 대화가 스토리에 직접적으로 연관되어 있어 플레이어가 더 몰입하도록 한다. 다만 처음 이 퍼즐이 나올 때 아무 힌트가 없다는 점이 문제다. 이정도는 튜토리얼 차원에서 알려줘야 하는거 아니냐? 이것 말고도 튜토리얼이 전반적으로 부족해 퍼즐 파트에세 헤메기 쉽다. (그래도 2시간컷 가능)

그것 말고도 조작 키가 불편하고 (상호작용은 q,e,좌클릭,우클릭 4개에 소지품은 화살표 왼쪽,오른쪽,아래 키 사용) 최적화 문제인지 게임이 좀 느리긴 한데 그것 말고는 무난한 퍼즐게임이다. 굳이 아쉬운점을 꼽자면 스토리가 핵심인데 속 시원하게 설명을 안해서 안풀린 떡밥이 너무 많다는 점. [spoiler]그래서 토끼가면은 누구고 스칼렛은 왜 가면이 생겼는데[/spoiler]

또 다른 특이한 점이라면 스칼렛이 갑자기 불을 흡수한 다음 손에서 불을 뿜고, 무생물에 생명을 부여하는 등 요술을 부리는데, 어차피 현실이 아니라 그런다지만 좀 깬다....

author: {'steamid': '76561198080319088', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1619877220}
review:
Blackwood Crossing is short, doesnt overstay its welcome and has a somewhat deep story. However, it is a walking Sim, keep that in mind, before you expect riviting gameplay.

Its a roughly 1,5 - 2 hour feeltrip, 2,5 hours if you care about getting all achievements. So be warned, if youre easily triggered by sensitive topics like death and depression, this isnt the game for you. 
I wont get into the story and spoil the main feature of the game for you. I can however say that the plot isn't too complex, but it's very neatly presented and doesn't feel annoying or superficial, like in most cases in this genre.

Because this game is this short and doesnt really offer much, I have to advise you to wait for a sale. Probably worth 5 bucks, if youre into games like this, but charging 16€, or probably $18 is just completely overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995403764', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1617144609}
review:
[h1]The longest, slowest train ride known to man[/h1]
[quote]This game was cheap on sale, so I thought I'd bite the bullet & I bought Blackwood Crossing. I knew it was a walking sim but that didn't bother me. I'm a fan of Firewatch, Unfinished Swan and the Stanley Parable. These games were fun, had a good story and a message to tell. Blackwood Crossing? Definitely not.[/quote]

[h1]Story[/h1]
The teenage girl Scarlett tries to make sense of her younger brother Finn's intense emotional needs. The children were orphaned while Finn was still very small. He is angry and confused by his attempts to reconcile this terrible loss, of a love he has no recollection of experiencing. These bewildering feelings are exacerbated by Scarlett's drift into adulthood. She loves her playful, imaginative, sweet-natured sibling. But her life is offering more than just playing with her little brother

The game tells a mystery story, it takes place in an Alice in Wonderland dream-like world, in which magic exists alongside evil, where ghosts speak, family members wear masks & toys come alive. These things capture the innocence of Finn, but you're about to find out that something awful happened in this family.

[h1]What's so bad about it?[/h1]
a. It's so goddamn slow
I really can't wrap my mind around the fact that this game has gone through multiple testing phases. The developers must've known that the game is an absolute mess to [i]playl[/i]. It's ike you're constantly dragging your feet through a thick puddle of slime. In other words: you're awfully slow and your character can't run. Gloopy, clumsy and plain bad controls. When you're walking through a long corridor, the game feels unnecessarily drawn out. It could be a bad port, but that really ruined this game for me.

b. Failed emotional connection
The game tries to use metaphors to convey a heartfelt message. It tries to, but it comes a mile short. At no point did I feel engaged with the characters. I didn't feel touched by the story because it's brought in such a weird way. Don't get me wrong, sometimes 'weird' works. But not here. The writing and the voice acting are so unnatural it takes you out of the game, only to put your focus on the messed up controls.

c. Weird gameplay mechanics
The game consists of walking, solving puzzles & interacting with various objects like darkness/fire. Most of the time, it's really unclear what's expected of you. Especially if you come across your first 'puzzle', that consists of putting dialogue between several characters in the correct order. There's no pop-up, no explanation, nothing. You just have to figure it out. Normally I like that type of approach, but it felt lacking in this title. Additionally, I had difficulty interacting with objects because I always had to position the reticle in an exact spot for a prompt to appear.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[quote]If you can look past the flaws of 'Blackwood Crossing', you might enjoy it. For me personally, it's very hard to find positive things to say about this game. I regret spending money on this, even if it was on sale. The story didn't have any impact on me, the gameplay is weird and you. can't. run. It's definitely a [b]no-buy[/b] from me. Being the only game PaperSeven has ever created, a lot of people seem to agree with me.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561199036503764', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 379, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1613680787}
review:
Меня не зацепило: приятная анимация и задуманная трогательной история не перевесили минусы.

Во-первых, угловатость управления. Вероятно, с геймпадом дела обстояли бы лучше, но он вряд ли ускоряет движение главной героини и избавляет игроков от неестественных невидимых стен на пути, так что проблема явно не только в клавиатуре и мышке.

Во-вторых, неинтуитивный символизм. Уверен, что при желании многие элементы игры можно интерпретировать очень по-разному, но дело именно в том, что над этим приходится думать, то есть сразу они не ощущаются. В итоге у меня не получилось проникнуться историей.

В-третьих, упущенные возможности. Есть приёмы, которые показались мне интересными, но они не получили должного развития. [spoiler]Смесь нескольких пространств в одном месте: движущийся поезд, в котором есть кусочек сада с неподвижным пейзажем за окном, а также растущее из вагона дерево. Детское воспроизведение деталей мира: созданные Финном бумажные фрагменты, которые без его пояснений не распознать, потому что он просто не разбирается и не умеет рисовать. Да хотя бы умение оживлять предметы![/spoiler] Всё это могло бы позволить игроку посмотреть на мир через призму восприятия героев, но увы и ах.

Извини, Blackwood Crossing, наверняка, для тебя найдутся свои ценители, но я не стал одним из них.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1600724611}
review:
In Blackwood Crossing wacht man als junge Erwachsene Scarlett in einem Zugabteil auf und muss seinen Bruder Finn suchen. Das klappt zunächst problemlos aber unmittelbar darauf spielen sich im Zug schräge und schrägste Dinge ab und man befindet sich auf einer geradezu wahnsinnigen Reise im Stile von Alice im Wunderland.

Und ja, das Ganze mutet teilweise grotesk und schräg an. Trotzdem setzen sich dadurch die Puzzleteile langsam zusammen und ergibt das Ganze an Ende nach rund 2,5 Stunden durchaus seinen Sinn. Dabei spielt sich das Ganze wie ein seichtes Adventure oder einen etwas interaktiveren Walking Simulator in kleinen Arealen. Spielerisch also ist das Ganze bis auf das eine oder andere Rätsel keine grosse Herausforderung.

Leider ist Blackwood Crossing technisch keine Meisterleistung. Das Spiel ist sehr mühsam zu steuern, das Ganze ist ziemlich ruckelig und insgesamt wirkt es von dieser Seite her einfach nicht rund. Und im Normalfall wäre das schon ein ziemlich dicker Minuspunkt. Doch es gibt etwas, dass das alles vollkommen aufwiegt: Die Story.

Ja, diese wirkt tatsächlich zunächst grotesk und unklar. Aber je mehr sich das Ganze zusammensetzt, desto inhatlsvoller wird die Geschichte und desto berührender. Es gibt nicht viele Spiele, die es wirklich schaffen, mein Herz zu berühren. Blackwood Crossing hat es geschafft und zwar auf eine meisterhafte Art und Weise. Was für eine wertvolle und gefühlvolle Story!

Und diese wird wunderbar unterstützt durch die tollen Sprecher. Und auch die Grafik ist zwar insgesamt zweckmässig aber doch auch meist sehr passend.

Fazit: Wer berührende Storys mag, der sollte sich vom technisch mauen Grundgerüst auf keinen Fall abschrecken lassen. Blackwood Crossing ist ein berührendes, wertvolles Story-Erlebnis, das sich lohnt gespielt zu haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089178564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1598490471}
review: Nice imagery and interesting tale, but disturbing as it is about a teenage girl and her younger brother, who is seriously disturbed, psychotic, selfish, egotistical and dangerous. Finn allows his older sister no freedom to grow up, is jealous and causes her harm, fear and distress. If he grew up he would not care about her then, yet she must give him all her time. Yet she apologises to him! Finn traps Scarlett in train of his imagining, and the trapped feeling is oppressive througout most of the game. It is irritating when the game tells you what to do when, I would rather work it out myself, not be told when to press Q or E to do something for example. Other than that it is a clever idea well made and some scenes are beautiful. Would prefer more apologies from Finn and for him to accept he cannot control everyone and everything.

review:
Nem szégyellem, hogy felnőtt férfi létemre megkönnyeztem ezt a történetet. Csodálatos, fájdalmas de érzelemdús  három órát adott. Tökéletesen eltalált és kimért sztori, nem csúszik át giccsbe, nem szirupos, olyan mint az élet. Ajánlom azoknak akik nem félnek megélni az érzéseiket!
Technikailag egy sétaszimulátor, kalandjáték ötvözettel van dolgunk, nagyon szép a játék, remekül helyén van a zene is. Újrajátszhatósági faktor nincs, hogy a pénztárcánkat kíméljük érdemes egy akció keretében megvenni, mert hosszához képest elég borsos az ára.
Jusplathemusnak köszönhetően hozzám hasonló angolul nem értő sorstársaim is élvezhetik a játékot. Igényes fordítást készített hozzá. Köszönjük!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3960, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1587460609}
review:
[b][i]Blackwood Crossing[/i] ou les tribulations mélancoliques d'une jeune femme sur les pas de son petit frère à travers les wagons d'un train et dans le secret d'une cabane dans les arbres.[/b]


Scarlett se retrouve en compagnie de son petit frère Finn à bord d'un train curieusement déserté par les autres voyageurs. Elle va rapidement rencontrer de mystérieux personnages masqués et observer des phénomènes étranges.


Davantage [i]walk sim[/i] que aventure-action, le jeu ne présente aucune difficulté réelle et repose essentiellement sur sa dimension narrative. L'histoire est touchante et possède quelques passages particulièrement poétiques, voire poignants. 

Dans un environnement qui alterne entre rêve et réalité, normalité et fantastique, Scarlett doit recréer des liens et reconstituer le passé en se confrontant à des thèmes comme les souvenirs, la culpabilité, les remords, le pardon, le deuil, l'amour, la vie, la mort.


Outre l'intérêt de l'histoire, il faut également signaler que la DA est plutôt réussie, entre le style élégamment épuré du menu, les graphismes sympas et la bande-son agréable.


Malheureusement le jeu contient également plein de petits défauts.
D'abord il est extrêmement linéaire et impose de multiples aller-retours. On renonce rapidement à prendre l'initiative d'explorer car cette démarche n'est uniquement utile quand on nous demande expressément de le faire.

Ensuite, les déplacements de Scarlett sont excessivement heurtés et exagérément lents.

Et puis on pourra mentionner également des options de dialogue sans réel impact (choix du ton adopté dans notre réplique), les mêmes lieux recyclés plusieurs fois dans des versions légèrement différentes et la gestion de l'inventaire pas très pratique (même si on y a recours que très ponctuellement). 

Enfin, concernant la durée de vie très courte (2h, max 3h si on traîne en route), elle laisse le joueur sur des sentiments contradictoires : d'une part "[i]oh dommage l'aventure est déjà finie, on aurait voulu continuer l'aventure[/i]" et d'autre part "[i]c'était surtout long à cause de la vitesse de déplacement car le récit pourrait en fait tenir en 30 minutes[/i]".



En bref, [i]Blackwood Crossing[/i] se distingue essentiellement par l'intérêt de son histoire servie par une agréable DA plutôt réussie, mais le plaisir de jeu peut être restreint par son gameplay souvent frustrant et agaçant. Typiquement le genre de jeu à prendre en cas de rabais important, en attendant que les développeurs sortent éventuellement un nouveau jeu.

C'est pour vous si vous appréciez les jeux narratifs et si vous estimez que les émouvants thèmes abordés ne sont pas dissuasifs.

C'est pas pour vous si vous attendez un jeu d'aventure-action dans lequel votre perso peut courir et sauter dans tous les coins.

review:

Unlike my play-through of What Remains of Edith Finch, this game didn't draw me in or really cause me to empathize with the characters in any way.  I generally just found the little brother annoying.  I understand that's very subjective, but given the fact that the asking price for this game is around the same as Edith Finch, I'd recommend buying that instead.  Way more thought was put into that game than this one in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971636562', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1584654553}
review:
I was surprised how much I didn't like this game. I very rarely write negative reviews but this game angers me. Probably because of lost potential.

I bought it based on the visuals and good review score. I generally like this kind of games but this not one of them.

Initially I was very disappointed in controls. I played with gamepad and movement and controls felt very uncomfortable. The active areas were kind of hard to point at easily. The game reacts extremely slow on your actions. Not that it's stuttering or anything. It's just designed to be that way. Early on because of the movement in the game it gave me motion sickness.

Well, I could overcome bad controls and some motion sickness but the story is c*ap. I understand the authors tried to make some tragic story but I've played much better one based on the same idea. The dialogs are not interesting. The very few there are. The puzzles are non-existent. I don't know. Maybe it is a walking simulator kind of game?

I'm not sure if the game couldn't blossom because it was too short but I couldn't wait to get to the end and be done with it. It's extremely short length is probably it's biggest plus. You're done fast with this torture of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207929331', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1678151526}
review:
As someone who cried at this game I do highly recommend it! That said I do agree the controls were a bit janky in places and it was short for a game. That said if you love atmospheric games, emotionally devastating games and walking simulators than boy howdy this is the game for you.

If you're also like me a huge horror wuss there are no jump scares, it is mostly atmospheric, the closest is a scene at the end but you know it is coming and it's meant to be more emotionally distressing than jumpscare.

I ended the game crying and loving the characters. I would've loved a longer game to get to know them more but I don't know that could've stood the emotional impact had the game been longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977682039', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1581873988}
review:
After about 3 hours i just finished Blackwood Crossing and i really liked it. It's a nice little story with great visual and audio art. Not much gameplay or challenge involved, it's mainly a story exploration game, but that's basically what i expected. Don't want to spoiler anything, so no details about the story. But i liked it and the voice acting and character design were good too.

On the other side though there were some annoying technical issues in this game. First i played with mouse and keyboard, but the game always tried to "force" me to use the gamepad by showing me tutorial messages for gamepad elements all the time. The keyboards controls aren't customizable (which may be an issue for some, for me it wasn't). After all the controls worked, but felt unpolished.

And then there's an even bigger issue with the camera. The field of view is VERY low, very zoomed in and shaky and it's not customizable. I play a lot in vr, so i thought motion sickness isn't an issue for me, but i was wrong. I had to pause every 15 to 20 minutes to watch out of a window or do something else, because i was feeling really uncomfortable. I hope this'll get fixed or at least the devs do this better in their next game.

But all the technical issues aside ... i really liked the game, the story, the characters and the little tasks to do and the price is absolutely okay for me. Yes, it's a short game and you can buy much longer games for less money, but that's not really the point. The devs obviously put a lot of work in the art and the storytelling and imho it was worth my time and money.

Buy it if you like games like The Vanishing of Ethan Carter or What remains of Edith Finch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141595877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1580173293}
review:
Blackwood Crossing is a surreal story-driven first-person game where you explore the fragile relationship between orphaned sister and brother, Scarlett and Finn.  A mysterious figure crosses the path of the siblings and nothing is really as it seems as you witness a transformation from childhood to adulthood and loss in Blackwood Crossing.

This game is a walking simulator with some creative and fresh puzzles to solve to progress from one part to the next—but sadly not many of those puzzles.  Most of the game takes place on a train though we do see several other locations throughout the run of Blackwood Crossing but there are no exploration opportunities for any location beyond the very basic.  However, it is important to note that this game is more of a story being told rather than an exploration of the world. 

The controls were very easy, and the screen hints were not too obnoxious.  Additionally, the game world was rich and gorgeous even though there were few vistas to take in.  The story, sadly, is where the game falls flat—even after three playthroughs I was still a bit unsure as to what exactly what the tale was and I would have liked more closure or even more clarity in the overall story.  I wanted more, but the developers didn’t give anything else that was satisfying.  This game could be considered too deep or esoteric for some individuals or simply unfinished and even rushed.

However, I feel that this game, while short, is good…not great, but not horrible either.  In all, it is difficult to recommend this game as for me it was enjoyable but not memorable. In the end I would recommend this game if it was on sale and if you enjoy story games with interesting characters and a beautiful world but are not too concerned about the story.  Who knows, you may find more meaning in Blackwood Crossing than I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096404643', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1579528612}
review:
Ich wünschte manchmal echt, dass es einen neutralen Bewertungsbutton auf Steam gäbe. Trotzdem empfehle ich es, da es mehr positive als negative Eigenschaften hat. Das Spiel an sich ist nicht schlecht, allerdings ist es auch nicht besonders herausragend. Das sich durchziehende Thema ist hierbei Verlust. Die Story dreht sich um die beiden Geschwister Finn und seine ältere Schwester Scarlett, die man steuert. Man durchlebt einige Traumwelten-ähnliche Szenen, die meist in einem Zug spielen.  

Ich hab das Game mit Controller gespielt. Die Steuerung war ganz okay, auch wenn mich die Fortbewegungsgeschwindigkeit oft in den Wahnsinn getrieben hat. Der Grafikstil sieht wirklich hübsch aus und manche Szenen könnte man glatt als Wallpaper verwenden. An manchen Stellen wirkt Scarletts Synchro etwas merkwürdig und bringt einen eher zum Lachen, da sie in gewissen Situation etwas absurd bzw. aufgesetzt wirkt. 

Auch die Story war manchmal eher verwirrend, was von sich aus jetzt nicht immer gleich was Schlechtes sein muss. Hier bin ich mir diesbezüglich jedoch nicht so sicher, könnte aber auch einfach an mir liegen. Ebenso kommt die Auflösung ziemlich abrupt (die man aber schon länger vermutet hat) und das Ende ist auch eher so lala. 

Dennoch ist es eine interessante Erfahrung und ich bin trotzdem froh, es gespielt zu haben. Allerdings würde ich eher auf einen Sale warten, falls ihr das Spiel wirklich ausprobieren wollt. Zumindest bin ich froh, es damals im Sale gekauft zu haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017076824', 'num_games_owned': 9310, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1577993797}
review:
[h1]Blackwood Crossing [/h1]

The story certainly had promise and touched on both common and difficult subject matter. I felt I should have been more moved however, and although sympathetic to the events and interested in the outcome, fundamentally it felt flatter than it should have done.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
👍 Excellent Visuals 
👍Superb soundtrack and sound effects
👍Professional voice acting
👍Achievements 

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
👎Too short. Only 2-3 Hours of playtime. 
👎 Characters aren’t developed enough and therefore the story didn’t feel as emotional as it could have been.
👎Main character walks too slow. 

[h1] First Impressions[/h1]
[b]We all suffer from some sort of regret in our lives. Whether it is something trivial like a bad decision or something more serious. This game explores the actions of a sibling towards her brother viewed through his eyes. [/b]

We start off on a moving train and Scarlett is sitting with her brother watching the scenery fly by. Her brother runs off and he calls for Scarlett to find her. As Scarlett plays the game she travels further down the train. The more she travels the stranger events become. She soon realizes that she has entered a world of her brother Finn’s creation. 

Finn uses his imagination to paint vivid and surreal pictures of his childhood and relationship with his sister. Some good times, some bad times. Scarlett comments on these events and they both have a frank and honest discussion about how they saw their upbringing. 

Finn introduces other important characters in his childhood including his parents, grandparents, his school teacher, a school bully, Scarlett’s boyfriend and a rabbit. Scarlett can interact with these personalities and they will speak a sentence of dialogue. Each character has once sentence to say and their words will be linked to another person. Scarlett’s task is to link the corresponding dialogues to progress. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1954728983

There are objects you can pick up which might be needed to solve a simple puzzle or for Finn or Scarlett to comment on. Not all objects can be interacted with however. 

That is the premise of the game. Travel through the train whilst watching Finn’s depiction of his childhood and relationship with his sister Scarlett. 

The story is the main attraction in the game and I can’t go into too much detail without giving anything away. It is mostly a walking simulator but there is still a bit of interaction needed to progress the story. There are a handful of puzzles you’ll need to complete ranging in difficulty from easy to moderate. 

The visuals and sound are superb and look incredibly professional. Voice acting is impressive and well-acted and all locations are well drawn and fit nicely into the world of Finn’s creation. 

Even though I enjoyed my time with Blackwood Crossing I just felt that not enough time was given for me to connect with the characters. We don’t know much about their parents or grandparents. They seem very peripheral. We only briefly get to know Scarlett’s boyfriend and Finn’s school teacher. They all have small cameo roles. The only characters we really get any insight into is Finn and Scarlett and even then, I felt it was not enough. 

I wonder whether the high quality of the game played a detrimental part in the story. The game is only two hours long whereas I think it should have been five or six to really delve into each character and become invested. 

It was an interesting story but it didn’t emotionally connect with me as I would have hoped. 

[h1]It had a lot of the correct ingredients but the cake was not left long enough in the oven. [/h1] 

[b]I would certainly recommend the game but considering the length I would only pick it up in a major sale. I was happy with the 60% off I paid for it. [/b]

[h1]Story[/h1] 🕹️
The story can be interpreted in many ways. It has a main theme and the story is apparent. In fact, I would presume that most players will guess the ending long before it happens and it becomes a case of following the chain of events to their conclusion. After the game had finished, I did ponder on what had happened and I felt a little confused. 

At its core it is a simple story of siblings and their relationship. Scarlett, the older sibling, sees things from a different perspective to Finn. Being older, she has different priorities to Finn who just wants to play and become king of Finnland, a fictional land of his creation. Elements of their relationship are explored and they talk about how they feel and how certain events affected them. 

Sometimes, the narration takes a very surreal and exciting twist wonderfully depicted by the graphics and sound. It is interesting viewing the story through a more immature perspective. Finn’s imagination can often run wild and the way he chooses to explain and show events that were pivotal are certainly entertaining to watch. 

Ultimately, the story lacks depth however, mainly due to its length and inability to connect you with its characters. It is a real shame as it is an interesting story which could have been so much better if I cared more about the characters. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1954728565

 [h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The majority of the game is set on a moving train. You move from carriage to carriage interacting with the handful of characters, listening to what they say and pairing conversations to unlock doors to the next carriage. These conversations have bearing on the story and will fill in gaps and add back story to the events told by Finn and Scarlett. 

On many occasions Finn will set you puzzles to overcome or challenges to complete to progress. They are mostly a formality but can feel quite exciting sometimes due to the wonderful graphics and sound that accompany them. An example of a puzzle was to find photos around the carriage which depicted a scene Finn used to act out in his tree house. Once you found the pictures you had to re-arrange them in the correct order which would spell out a password and gain entrance to his tree house. 

The story takes you where Finn’s imagination roams and we often find ourselves removed from the train into another land or we watch the train transform and take a different shape. Although the story is quite linear it never feels boring or uninteresting due to the way the world is constantly evolving. 

It is notable that Scarlett is a slow walker and it becomes a little annoying when we do venture off the train and have to walk long distances. I wouldn’t say it was a major issue but I guarantee you will be looking for the sprint button. [spoiler] There isn’t one! [/spoiler] 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1954728070

[h1]Sound:[/h1]  🎵
The sound was impressively executed and added tension when needed. Voice acting was superb and professionally acted throughout by every character. 

 [h1]Graphics:[/h1]  📺
Probably the highlight of the game was the visual treat on offer. I was very impressed with this aspect and it felt very polished for a cheaper game. It had quite a cartoon like appearance but all objects were realistic and the imagery and imagination used in bringing some of the scenes to life were amazing. 

 [h1]Conclusion[/h1]
It is such a shame that this game wasn’t longer and the characters were not analyzed and explored further. 

The story certainly had promise and touched on both common and difficult subject matter. I felt I should have been more moved however, and although sympathetic to the events and interested in the outcome, fundamentally it felt flatter than it should have done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1560743265}
review:
I do not recommend Blackwood Crossing. It's slow, boring, and clunky. Interacting with this world is annoying. The character moves slowly through the environment and there's a delay to interacting with items in the game world that meant I'd have to go very slowly over objects to make sure it could be interacted with or not. 

It's a walking simulator trying to pull at your heartstrings, but the execution just comes across like a bunch disjointed scenes that don't really build upon each other to an emotional payoff. The same locations are used over and over and are connected with dream logic. It's like the game is just spinning its wheels for 2 hours, then it ends. 

Blackwood Crossing just kept coming across as a much weaker version of the superb What Remains of Edith Finch. That was a game where creative game play and artistic symbolism were used to tell an interesting story that delivered a satisfying payoff. Blackwood Crossing does none of these things. It's just a bunch of half-baked elements that seem randomly thrown together. It's like a robot designed this game that checked all the boxes for a successful game, but didn't understand how the elements are supposed to fit together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074519555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1558629051}
review:
Attention léger SPOILERS.
Je ne sais pas si j'ai aimé vraiment ce jeu qui a un certain charme et est vraiment original ou si je me serai bien abstenue d'y jouer tellement j'ai trouvé l'histoire triste, mélancolique, obsédante et exaspérante parfois. On joue le personnage d'une jeune fille qui suit son petit frère dans un train très spécial. Petit frère énervant au possible qui s'échappe de wagon en wagon où l'on rencontre des personnages masqués aux dialogues qui se répondent (paires à trouver). Ecouter les dialogues permet de comprendre petit à petit l'histoire. Le mal"-être" est personnifié par cette fumée/vapeur noire qu'il faut vaincre par la lumière (toutes les lumières). Le train donne accès à un autre monde de souvenirs où il faut toujours écouter ces personnages pour avancer dans l'histoire et interagir avec les bons objets parfois.
Perso, ne pas y jouer si vous n'avez pas le moral ; vous risquez la dépression complète. C'est la première de ma vie que je pleure à la fin d'un jeu. La musique et les effets sonores sont assez lancinants mais cela va bien avec le thème.
Côté graphique, c'est plutôt bien. C'est assez jouable même avec une manette configurée avec ce360.exe (freebox).
Finalement je ne regrette pas d'avoir expérimenté un "jeu" inhabituel pour moi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198852516814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1553554127}
review:
Frankly, this deserves a better rating. 9-9.5/10 really. 

This is one of those games that really only has 2-3 game elements -- both a variation on match-A-to-B puzzles; so, a relatively simple game mechanic.

What this game does well is immerse you in a short, intimate story about coping with loss.  And yes the walking is slow, and heavy, but the areas are short, and it paces the feeling of the story -- you shouldn't be able to run; running is about energy, joy, excitement.

Yes, Finn is a "brat"; but he's also a young child. He's the kid that is throwing a temper tantrum at a restaurant, and that you just think, "Will somebody shut this wretch up?" That is, until you have a kid of your own, and you've experienced the feeling of losing control with a melting down child.

Alternatively, you might find yourself relating to Scarlet -- there's no surprises with the story, and you know what's going to happen, but the magic lies in relating to this very real desire to run away, to lose yourself in your grief at the loss of a loved one.

This is not a game for everyone; it's a niche experience built around a feeling of compassion for and commiseration with the main character who is very flawed herself. It's a [b][i]good[/i][/b] game, and one that will likely disappoint gamers looking for sex, ultra-violence, and/or Beethoven (though it does have a vaguely country sounding ending theme, for what that's worth).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970552707', 'num_games_owned': 1935, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1551082048}
review:
I enjoy walking sims and adventure games, but this one didn't really do anything for me. I didn't like Finn at all, he was just a spoiled bratty kid. It's not that he's unbelievable as a character, I just really didn't like him. The story mostly hinges on your character's relationship with Finn and your own emotional attachment, so it completely fell flat for me.

Throw in the incredibly slow walking speed and no sprint.
The camera weirdly being both sluggish and sometimes far too fast. (Broken mouse acceleration?)
And a pretty predictable storyline.
I'd say pass on this one unless it's on a really big sale, or you like bratty characters I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351177738', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1550725896}
review:
I had almost no expectations for this game going in, all I'd seen was the trailer.

And I can say it far exceeded all the expectations I could have had for it. Though the inability to run did frustrate me at times, and take away from some moments of tension. Most other things made up for this though as the game was beautifully written and animated. I genuinely wish there was more game for me to play through. At some points it was surreal and unsettling, others emotional and heartfelt, but most of the time it was all of the above. 

Short and sweet. I do see the potential this game had for a much more rich and epic narrative that delved deeper and created more compelling characters that could have spanned hours, which I would have liked a lot more. 

But I'm also happy with what I got. I'm glad I bought it on sale rather than full price as it was so short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089611017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1535404830}
review: This game was intriguing and beautiful, and I think very clever in its execution of [spoiler]being inside a child's mind.[/spoiler] Certain puzzles were very difficult and unintuitive which was both refreshing and frustrating because it forces you to really look at each level closely. I wish the ending had felt more clear and somewhat rewarding. [spoiler]Sad[/spoiler]  endings can certainly have happy elements or something that makes the puzzles feel worth it, but the game's emotional ending fell a bit flat for me and felt somewhat hollow to me - perhaps because the game needed to be a bit more lengthy to have an emotional connection with the characters. I would recommend playing this game for its unique gameplay and challenging puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038768193', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1544858590}
review:
Blackwood: Crossing зачастую сравнивают с Life is Strange, аргументируя это тем, что в обоих проектах главными героями являются дети, в сюжете присутствует немного мистики, и там, и тут рассказывается драма близких друг для друга людей, а до кучи жанр у обоих проектов один – симулятор ходьбы. Однако у B: C имеются многочисленные фундаментальные проблемы, которые не позволяют оценить эту игру столь же высоко, как и LiS.

Сюжет повествует о взаимоотношениях девочки-подростка Скарлетт и её младшего брата по имени Финн. Поначалу история окунает игрока с головой в мистику: местом действия практически всю игру является некий поезд, мчащийся по чертогам разума то ли девочки, то ли её брата из ниоткуда в никуда, а его пассажиры – это близкие для Скарлетт и Финна люди, роль которых в повествовании раскрывается постепенно и интригующе. И чем дальше в лес, тем сильнее сценаристы накручивают вполне неплохую драму, наполненную как светлыми и добрыми моментами, так и серьёзными, взрослыми последствиями, которые в теории способны надолго заставить вас погрузиться в пучину печальных воспоминаний.

Пусть и банальная, но, тем не менее, трогательная история могла бы получиться действительно слёзовыжимательной, не разбейся она о слабую режиссуру, плохой игровой процесс и никакую техническую реализацию. Начнём с первого. Диалоги между братом и сестрой хоть и сыграны актёрами достаточно неплохо (Финн так вообще озвучен на твёрдую пятёрку), но написаны будто по учебнику. Вот ребята вместе веселятся. Вот вместе играют. А здесь Скарлетт перестаёт уделять внимание брату, встретив первую любовь. Тут он на сестру за это обижается. А здесь Скарлетт разгребает последствия игнорирования просьб Финна рассказать ему о родителях, которых он в силу возраста совсем не помнит.

И это не спойлеры, а типичные клише почти любой семейной драмы о братьях и сёстрах. Blackwood: Crossing строго следует этим установкам, не отступая ни на шаг. История несётся к финалу так стремительно, что не даёт почувствовать игроку ту очень близкую, интимную связь между братом и сестрой. Режиссёр смешивает в кучу временны'е метки взаимоотношений Финна и Скарлетт: например, практически в самом начале девочка видит сцену, как она сама игнорирует брата, болтая по телефону, а значительно позже Скарлетт помогает Финну в его домике на дереве, хотя по логике всё должно быть наоборот. Из-за этих time paradox'ов и бешеных прыжков из настоящего в прошлое и обратно, между братом и сестрой не успевает загореться огонёк, который игрок мог бы принять близко к сердцу.

Позволю себе привести всего один сторонний пример: маленький эпизод Farewell для Life is Strange: Before the Storm, который также проходится за час-полтора. Даже если не играть в основные LiS, а запустить Farewell, игрок наверняка успеет проникнуться историей Хлои и Макс, благодаря мелочам, тонким нюансам, которые связывают девочек друг с другом. В Blackwood: Crossing такие нюансы либо попросту не дожаты, либо отсутствуют напрочь. Из-за этого концовка, которая по идее должна выбить почву из-под ног, попросту не справляется без этой химии между Финном и Скарлетт.

Игровой процесс, которым авторы попытались разбавить симулятор неспешной прогулки, ломает подачу сюжета ещё больше. В тот момент, когда игрока действительно нужно гнать в шею, окуная его в холодный душ трогательного финала, геймплей тормозится на ровном месте из-за жуткого пиксель-хантинга и неудачно реализованных паззлов. К тому моменту, когда вы догадаетесь, что нужно сделать, тягостная атмосфера финала уже улетучится. А что уж говорить про начало и середину, где этой атмосферы по описанным выше причинам нету вовсе?..

Головоломки в Blackwood практически всегда представляют собой необходимость собрать в правильной последовательности кусочки диалогов других персонажей. Сама по себе эта задача не является невыполнимой, однако зачастую бабушка, которая разговаривает с дедушкой, находится в одной части поезда, а дед – в другой. И ходить между ними, попутно делая абсолютное ничего, утомляет. А ведь нужно соединить не только их двоих, но и других участников представления. В другом конкуренте игры – в Firewatch – Генри с Делайлой практически всегда разговаривали, раскрывая сюжет там, где герой по факту просто пересекает лес из одного угла карты в другой. В B:C Скарлетт с Финном перебрасываются всего лишь одной-двумя универсальными для семейной драмы фразами, оставляя затем игрока в объятиях музыки. К чести композитора, саундтрек умеет порой задавать нужную атмосферу.

Другой тип паззлов – это поиск предметов. С одной стороны, промахнуться мимо предмета сложно, с другой же, перебор с размытием порой не даёт разглядеть лежащий прямо под носом кусок ткани, так необходимый по сюжету. Этот пиксель-хантинг тоже не вызывает никаких положительных эмоций – одно лишь раздражение.

До кучи в B:C плохо обстоят дела с технической реализацией. Художники, конечно, постарались хорошо нарисовать интерьеры поезда и другие более открытые локации, однако, чем шире становится место действия, тем сильнее движок игры давится деталями, опуская кадровую частоту до нестабильных показателей, которые, кстати, воздействуют на охоту за пикселями. Видимо, с Unity инди-разработчики так и не научатся работать…

Столь же нелестный отзыв приходится оставлять управлению, которое ещё и нельзя переназначить. Скарлетт передвигается по уровню только пешком и исключительно неспешно.  И отзывчивостью героиня тоже похвастаться не может, из-за чего девочка часто застревает между ветками деревьев или в ножке стола. Не то чтобы это было критично, но это тоже тормозит повествование там, где его останавливать не нужно.

Вот и получается, что Blackwood: Crossing не может выдержать критику по сравнению с тем же Life is Strange. Рассказывая свою историю, B:C не хватает смелости уйти дальше типичных клише семейной драмы, а плохая техническая составляющая и неграмотная режиссура не дают хорошо раскрыться финалу, который мог бы вытянуть и без того запутанную поначалу историю. Слишком многое в ней работает плохо или не работает вовсе, отвлекая всё внимание на себя.

Поверьте, меня на слезу пробить чрезвычайно легко. От того же Farewell ваш покорный слуга ревел, как девчонка два-три дня. Там ведь история тоже проста и банальна, но то, как она рассказывается, - важно не меньше, а зачастую даже больше, чем содержание этой самой истории. К большому сожалению, Blackwood: Crossing оказалась практически не способна вызвать подобные эмоции. Поэтому мне крайне обидно ставить палец вниз проекту, который вполне мог бы стать вторым To the Moon. История Скарлетт и Финна заслуживает большего…

review: Great walking sim game, completed in 2-3 hours. This game has a very touching story and is sure to stir up some emotion in you! I would let my kids play it at 10 years or older, good empathy building game with a deep story. author: {'steamid': '76561198360273747', 'num_games_owned': 1578, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1543024890}
review:
It's a pretty short game. About 2.5 - 3 hours if you're going for 100%. Overall the story is sweet. But there's very little interaction you can do. And where you can, the puzzles are hard to figure out. Not because the puzzles are difficult, mind you. But because ( I don't know the technical term) the cursor detection when you hover over objects isn't the best so it's easy to miss what objects you can interact with. And even when you're facing the object head on it still has a hard time detecting it. 

The graphics are quite nice, like I said the story is short and decent.

My one complaint was the forced slow walking. Granted the game would have probably been done in 30  minutes if you could jog so that's fair I suppose. You want to care for the characters but when they send you on a fetch quest with wonky detection and walk at a snail's pace you can't help being annoyed with the little squirt. 

I'll recommend the game on sale. It's a short, sad story worth the experience but the controls sometimes overpower the immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073739030', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1703495396}
review:
Acabo de terminar el juego y creo que es momento de dar mi opinión, primero se debe tener en cuenta que el juego es un Walking Simulator, por lo que si este tipo de juegos no te atraen es mejor que dejes de leer esto y busques otro juego.

Blackwood Crossing cuenta la historia de dos hermanos, nosotros seremos la chica y tendremos que buscar a nuestro hermano pequeño, hasta ahí la historia principal por así decirlo.

Lo que me he dado cuenta de este juego es que te impide explorar los escenarios, o al menos esa es su intención, la incertidumbre de alejarte mucho de tu hermano hace que no quieras alejarte de el y continuar siguiendo su pista, por lo que explorar o no es decisión totalmente tuya.

La relación entre Finn y su hermana demuestra que el cariño y afecto entre los dos hermanos se ve fuertemente afectada por algo que ocurrió en el pasado y que nosotros tendremos que descubrir con el paso del tiempo, pienso que debieron profundizar mucho mas en la historia de ambos, sobretodo en la de Finn, porque aunque al final descubres todo lo que ha pasado y como termina, pienso que debieron profundizar mucho mas en ello.

Los momentos oscuros te hacen sentir la angustia, tu objetivo es intentar salvar a tu hermano pequeño a toda costa, mientras intentas recordad por qué esta ocurriendo esto, el juego esta muy bien la verdad, a pesar de ser demasiado corto, los puzzles, la música y sobretodo la trama te acabaran terminando de convencer.

[h1][b]Lo mejor de Blackwood Crossing[/b][/h1]
ːyellowbeatːLa magia y carisma de Finn
ːyellowbeatːMomentos de angustia y consuelo
ːyellowbeatːLa relación entre hermanos

[h1][b]Lo peor de Blackwood Crossing[/b][/h1]
ːyellowbeatːSu duración, poco mas de 3/4 horas

[i]Puntuación personal del juego:[/i][h1] 8.0 ★★★★★★★★☆☆[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198299224226', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1538091398}
review:
I was looking forward to Blackwood Crossing for a while, it sounded just up my street (my street being short, story-driven walking sims currently) and I had a couple of hours spare so I started it up.

The presentation is great, everything looks good, the voice acting was good enough and the gameplay promised to contain itself to a series of train carriages with interesting characters.

My computer isn't exactly a high spec gaming rig, but a Geforce 710 and a 2014 Core i3 couldn't get above around 20fps on the lowest graphics settings.  While I don't normally mind low frame rates, this did make it quite difficult to use the mouse to select things in the game, nothing I couldn't manage but I do wonder if something is amiss with my machine.

The story is good, it tells a tale of grief, sadness and anger from the perspective of a young boy through his older sisters eyes.  The puzzles very nicely include story exposition, the characters are consistent and believable and the scenery never goes stale, even though you might experience the same route a few times through this short game.

I did enjoy this game, but having not long played "What Remains of Edith Finch", which shares both theme and atmosphere and arguably does it better, I was slightly underwhelmed.  That for me is a shame because clearly a lot of love and thought went into this game and I did want to enjoy it more than I did.

While on one hand, I wouldn't recommend playing this game over something like "Edith Finch", I would recommend it for two hours of a well considered story, told through some simple but satisfying puzzles.

I got this game on sale for around £5 which I think is fine, the usual price of £12 might be a bit high.

review:
4.5 Mediocre

Grafica bella, personaggi carini, ben adornati, anche se pochi.

La storia si può dire interessante ma rovinata dal gamplay ripetitivo anche per la brevissima durata del titolo.

La protagonista non è in grado di correre e camminerà con una lentezza incomprensibile, cosa che temo serva ad "allungare il brodo" scelta che non appoggio, la durata è già breve, se togliessimo il tempo che ci fa perdere la lentezza di questa sottospece di camminata durerebbe molto di meno, la frustazione che si prova di tornare indietro dall'altra parte perchè si è capito che cosa fare è un pusgno nello stomaco.

Sembra che abbiano speso più tempo per curare le locandine dei film "tarocche", cosa che è molto piacevole da vedere ma è soltanto uno sfondo di uno scenario anche se si può sentire il pensiero della protagonsita.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1536509986}
review:
I have some mixed feelings about this game, but in the end I feel that a positive review is justified.

Many people said they got very emotional while playing this game, and I don't really understand that.
I personally, playing as the protagonist, felt adventuresome and confusion at the same time, until the very end of the game where I felt the sadness, but it wasn't at all as emotional as I was expecting; it was sad, but not a deep feeling of emotion, no tears, and it ended [b]very[/b] quickly.
After the credits a very short epilogue plays and then the game ends.
I wish that epilogue went on for at least 5-10 minutes to tie things up more and show what the protagonist was feeling after it was over.

The game itself was very entertaining to play, I enjoyed it very much, [i]I do love walking simulators[/i], but I don't think the story was that good.
It was decent, it was entertaining, but not what I was expecting at all.

Recommended partly because of the story, but largely due to the actual gameplay which is a walking simulator-esque adventure with a lot of interactivity from the player.

Like most other short exploration/adventure/walking simulator games this game is best played through in a single sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333940820', 'num_games_owned': 1171, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1544809909}
review:
[h1] [i] [b]«Одиночество — самое страшное, что может случиться с человеком. И неважно, кто этот человек, бедняк или богач, простак или хитрец, глупец или гений. Одиночество не стучится и не ждет, пока ему откроют, у него есть ключи ото всех дверей...»[/b] [/i] 	[/h1]


[i] В первую очередь это история о важности взаимопонимания и внимательности к окружающим тебя людям. Ведь наше равнодушие и беспечность по отношению к близким может нанести глубочайшую рану в душе важного человека, оставляя в нашем сердце лишь сожаление и боль от невозможности что-то исправить. 
История повествует нам о сиротах: старшей Скарлетт и ее брате Финне. В начале игры мы, казалось бы, видим, что их отношения полны взаимопонимания и тепла, но в процессе мы понимаем, что в реальности дела обстоят совершенно не так. Повзрослев, Скарлетт отдалилась от брата. Проводя большую часть времени в телефоне или со своим парнем, она совершенно не замечала одиночества Финна и без того страдавшего без родителей, которых он даже и не помнил. 

Сюжет нам преподносится в виде полной символизма сказки-притчи, а основное действие происходит в непрерывно движущемся поезде без машиниста и персонала, очевидно, символизирующего текущую саму по себе жизнь. Как и в жизни, поезд полон людей, когда-либо встречавшихся на жизненном пути детей. А проводником служит мальчик в маске Кролика, который явно напоминает нам Белого Кролика из "Алисы в стране чудес". И такими небольшими отсылками и символизмом наполнена вся игра, становясь от этого только интереснее. 

Геймплей в игре совсем несложен и, в основном заключается в решении простых загадок и нахождении нужных предметов. Этим разработчики позволяют нам полностью окунуться в захватывающую историю, главное в которой сюжет и атмосфера, пропитанные огромной любовью разработчиков к своему творению. А потрясающая музыка подходит к каждой локации и позволяет просто наслаждаться этой жизненной сказкой.

И это одна из тех немногих игр, которая действительно учит чему-то простому, жизненному. Она не претендует на повесть с глубоким смыслом, потому что посыл простой, но в тоже время важный: будте внимательнее к близким людям, возможно именно ваша улыбка и капелька внимания поможет им.	[/i]

В заключение хотелось бы определенно порекомендовать пройти эту потрясающую игру каким-нибудь пасмурным, холодным вечерком за чашечкой чая. Времени это, к сожалению, занимает немного, а положительных впечатлений остается море.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990706517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1535532055}
review:
This is only a negative review because there is no option for "Mixed"; had the game been a little bit longer (I finished it in one sitting), a little bit cheaper, or had provided more story resolution in the epilogue, it would be a positive one. 

I have the same problem with this game as I do with Doki Doki Literature Club: It's too short, so it feels like a vertical slice demo or tutorial level for a much longer, much more impressive interactive storytelling experience, rather than a full game. What is here, is well-executed; from the music, to the voice acting (seriously the music & VO are the best parts), to the story, to the game mechanics involving matching scattered conversation partners or manipulating fire/shadow to unlock new areas are engaging, even the graphics have a youthful charm I enjoyed. 

Ultimately though, this is like buying a pre-packaged sandwich from an airport kiosk: It looks good for what it is and what it costs, but once you buy it you find they shoved all the good bits towards the front of the package, so by the end you're left with some mostly-eaten pieces of bread thinking "that was good, but it really seems like there should have been more considering what I paid for it."

If you can get this game on sale, I would recommend it; just go into it with your eyes open, and don't be surprised when a game set on a moving train makes you feel like you're on rails!

author: {'steamid': '76561198320504738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1535372142}
review:
Un par de hermanos, Scarlett y Flinn, están realizando un viaje a bordo de un tren. De pronto Flinn desaparece en uno de lo vagones y es ahí donde empieza un viaje onírico que nos cuenta una historia sobre la relación entre un hermana que se hace mayor y su hermano menor que ve cómo es relejado, involucrando una carga emotiva hecha de nostalgia, pérdida, perdón y reconciliación, tanto con familiares, amigos y amores. 

Con un concepto de walking simulator, a través de la resolución de algunos puzzles, búsqueda de objetos, y hasta unos tintes de terror, iremos avanzando capítulo a capítulo a la vez que profundisamos en su narrativa especialmente centrada en las evocaciones visuales, con algunos guiños a películas o a libros como Alicia en el país de la maravillas. Su estética es muy colorida y con toques caricaturescos. Gráficamente cumple. Su banda sonora de pronto de hace recordar a la de Life is strange, un recursos más que acentúa la emoción y el sentimiendo del momento que se nos está contando. Parece que  los desarrolladores se centraron tanto en la carga narrativa, que dejaron de lado cosas como los controles, que son muy imprecisos, así como la nula variedad de movimientos ─no podemos correr─, lo que ocasionada que el ritmo se desface con respecto al ritmo narrativo en no pocas ocasiones. 

Con todo y sus fallas técnicas, mecánicas un tanto inncesarias, y su duración que apenas supera las dos horas, Blackwood Crossing es un juego que a lo largo de su historia llega a tocarte las fibras emocionales más profundas, haciéndote recordar inevitablemente momentos de tu vida, preguntándote si hiciste bien o mal. Aunque al principio puede parecer algo confusa y lenta. Cercano a juegos como Firewatch, Life is strange o What Remains of Edith Finch. Recomendado si quieres tirar algunas lágrimas o reparar en tu relación con los demás.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992764570', 'num_games_owned': 1777, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1535085117}
review:
The longest train I've ever trudged through.

I thought the story was good. I didn't feel completely invested in all the characters. I think there was a missed opportunity to add more feels to the game. I'm disappointed with rabbit boy's role in this game as I felt his character could have been much more (I kept thinking of Donnie Darko). It kept feeling like it was getting close to being a great story but never quite crossed that line. It might have been a combination of the restricted fov in first person and the characters movement that was unpleasant at times. Aside from that, my biggest complaint about the game is how frickin' slow the character walks, especially when having to backtrack. I'd have preferred faster movement even if it meant completing the game in less time as I would have come away more satisfied in the end.  Perhaps it was intentional to make sure people play beyond the 2 hour mark to avoid refunds. I don't know.

So, is it worth the sale price at 50%? I can't give it a strong recommendation, but the story was good enough that I don't have any regrets with the money or the time I spent on this game.

 - - - - - - - - - 
Some additional feedback (too much work to rework the original):

Here's the thing, while there were some things I disliked about the game, I did enjoy it. There were a couple of times I was like, if this train gets any longer, or if this tunnel I'm walking through takes any longer, I'm going to quit this game. However that was offset by the story that it was telling. Being able to empathise with the characters, what had happened, and the regrets. It came so close to being a great story that I would have emphatically recommended, but it's not quite there. I feel had the character's movement been 50% faster, more back story about the parents and grandparents, and more about the main character, it would have been great. The reason I harp about the character's speed is that I wanted to get to the next part, talk to the next person, complete the puzzles but the slow plod of the character was impeding that and bringing down my enjoyment of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062328053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1533245852}
review:
Le jeu m'interessait beaucoup mais au final je suis déçu par ce qu'il propose.
La narration est joliment écrite et touchante, Scarlett et Finn sont attachants, mais le jeu souffre terriblement de son gameplay.

En effet, le jeu est plutôt court, alors que j'ai eu le sentiment du contraire. Le personnage est horriblement lent, en particulier quand le jeu demande au joueur régulièrement de faire des aller/retour pour accomplir les objectifs. J'ai vraiment eu l'impression que les développeurs avaient eu besoin de rallonger la durée de vie quand j'ai constaté ce duo aller/retour et lenteur.

Certains diront que le gameplay n'est pas important dans ce genre de jeux mais je ne suis pas d'accord. Ici le gameplay a eu un impact trop important sur mon plaisir à suivre l'histoire. J'aurais peut être preferé un film d'animation de 40min.


En conclusion je le recommande au gens adeptent à ce genre de jeux centrés sur la narration, mais attendez qu'il soit soldé.
